repnme.cdata!:
Sao Tome and Principe - Public Resource
            Management Technical Assistance Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, a likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Among Program-related
            lessons it is highlighted this credit (unlike many typical
            Technical Assistance (TA) ones) gave the Bank the
            opportunity to engage the government on a large number of
            sectoral policy dialogues, as well as to build institutional
            capacity, particularly on petroleum sector issues, legal
            reforms, and public finance management issues. This was due
            to the nature of the small economy, and the large scope of
            the credit. Taking the following two lessons into account
            may ensure future TA projects will have the same positive
            effect on sectors covered by the credit. There should be
            flexibility in the provision of TA in order to adapt it to
            the changing needs of the government (in this case in the
            petroleum sector). It is important to keep a certain
            percentage of credit as unallocated, while flexibility of
            design is equally important in light of capacity-building
            activities, especially in terms of prioritizing capacity
            issues. Implementation-related lessons indicate that better
            preparation/training of the Project Implementation Unit
            (PIU) as of the early stages, would ensure an easier
            implementation process, especially on procurement and
            financial management issues. This leads to the essential
            need for a strong team, so that the burden does not fall on
            a single person, particularly, in the context of prevailing
            weak institutional capacity, and political volatility.

repnme.cdata!:
Sao Tome and Principe - Public Resource
            Management Credit (PRMC) Project : release of the Second
            Tranche - full compliance

abstracts.cdata!:
The reform program for Sao Tome and
            Principe, supported by the Public Resource Management
            Credit, has three key components: (1) improving domestic
            resource mobilization; (2) strengthening public expenditure
            management; and (3) continuing implementation of the public
            enterprise reform program. The Credit has complemented and
            deepened actions already agreed under the programs of the
            IMF, the African Development Bank and the European Union in
            the area of public expenditure management.  This report
            summarizes progress in the execution of the reform program
            and actions taken by the Government of Sao Tome and Principe
            (GSTP) to meet the specific conditions for the release of
            the second tranche. The report concludes that conditions for
            the release of the second tranche have been met and
            sufficient progress has been made in implementation of the
            overall program of reforms set out in the Letter of
            Development Policy (LDP) despite political instability and
            lack of institutional capacity. In addition, the Government
            is receiving Bank technical assistance in developing
            petroleum revenue legislation and building transparent
            institutional frameworks in the financial and petroleum
            sectors institutional frameworks that would be transparent
            and beneficial to the long term development of the country.
            In light of this performance, this report proposes that the
            second tranche of the Credit, in the amount of SDR 1.9
            million be released for disbursement.

repnme.cdata!:
Sao Tome and Principe - Public Resource
            Management Credit and Technical Assistance Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Resource Management Credit
            (PRMC) will assist in consolidating Sao Tome and
            Principe's macroeconomic stability, and attain
            competitiveness, while its supporting operation, the Public
            Resource Management Technical Assistance Project (PRMTA) was
            designed to provide the technical support, training, and
            equipment to implement policy measures, currently proposed
            under the reform program supported by the PRMC. The PRMTA
            will also implement sectoral, sub-sectoral, and specific
            studies, namely, through the financing of a study fund for
            these, and/or simulation models, required for the
            preparation of the Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper, and,
            will develop an agenda for macroeconomic, and sectoral
            policy reforms. The operations will benefit the
            implementation of tariff reforms, ensuring a harmonious
            development of the revised tariff system, with the common
            tariff of the Central African Economic and Monetary
            Community, and the Western African Economic and Monetary
            Union. In turn, private investments flows and improved
            resource mobilization, will impact economic diversification,
            and external trade, thereby enhancing productivity of public
            resources. However, the proposed agenda may face resistance,
            and social unrest, and, other risks are posed by low
            institutional capacity, limited donor commitment, and a weak
            private sector, although the Government is committed to
            outweigh these risks.
